Summary[edit]

DescriptionFlag of Jamaica.svg
Deutsch: Die Flagge Jamaikas
English: Flag of Jamaica. “The sunshine, the land is green, and the people are strong and bold” is the symbolism of the colours of the flag. GOLD represents the natural wealth and beauty of sunlight; GREEN represents hope and agricultural resources; BLACK represents the strength and creativity of the people. The original symbolism, however, was "Hardships there are, but the land is green, and the sun shineth", where BLACK represented the hardships being faced.
Nederlands: Vlag van Jamaica
Русский: Флаг Ямайки
Slovenščina: državna zastava Jamajke
Українська: Прапор Ямайки
Used colors

     Green rendered as RGB 000 119 073Pantone 3415 C
     Black rendered as RGB 000 000 000
Date 28 September 2005
Source Own work. Geometry and Pantone colour codes from jis.gov.jm. Pantone "Black C" is intentionally replaced with plain black (#000).
Author  The SVG code is valid. This vector image was created with Inkscape by SKopp, and then manually edited by Zscout370, Madden and others.

09:31, 7 November 20201,200 × 600 (311 bytes)OMGShay 92 (talk | contribs)Actually, this is the flag used in the 2012 Summer Olympics.
12:39, 1 November 20201,200 × 600 (325 bytes)VulpesVulpes42 (talk | contribs)Reverted to version as of 02:29, 26 May 2020 (UTC) With all due respect, you did not provide a valid reason for reverting. These shades are in fact officially prescribed by the Jamaican government (https://jis.gov.jm/media/2013/08/COLOUR-1.jpg). See also these photographs, also from government websites: https://jis.gov.jm/media/flag.jpg https://opm.gov.jm/wp-content/uploads/2017/02/national-flag-symbol.png
